messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Re: kogatana mei
messages.msgSnippet: Elliott - Stop teasing! Hurry up and post those pictures now that you got us all wanting to see them!! -t ... From: Elliott elliott@shibuiswords.com Date: Tue,
messages.messageBody:
Elliott -
Stop teasing! Hurry up and post those pictures now that you got us all
wanting to see them!!
-t


Original Message:
-----------------
From: Elliott elliott@...
Date: Tue, 27 Mar 2007 15:20:41 -0000
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: kogatana mei


Thank you Barry,

I did not doubt the mei, it was being told that it was TADASHIRO and
not finding that name anywhere. I looked in the Haynes index (which I
now proudly own) and found no such name. It is without a doubt
TADAHIRO.

I will send you pic's of another kogatana that has a mei. It looks
very suspicious to me, and I have no idea what it says. I will post
them into my album and send you same directly. Maybe it will be
legit, maybe not. Somebody at some time has tried to fake a hamon on
this little blade. I need to remove this, any ideas? I don't want to
spend any money on this blade unless the mei is real. Let me know
your thoughts. It's a learning experience!

Thanks,

Elliott



-- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Barry Thomas" <warlord@...>
wrote:
>
> G'day Elliot,
>
> Firstly the name is TADAHIRO, not TADASHIRO. I am well acquainted
with this smith as I have had a katana of his for many years plus
others of the school are well-known to me in other collections. And
I have the Hizento Taikan. And I have a book on kogatana. So,
please post me pics direct or I'm happy to look at them in your
album. Higher res is better then lower res to send me direct, as you
might resize them down for your album.
>
> I'm presuming here that you want to know if the mei is genuine??
>
> Regards,
> Barry Thomas.
>

Thank you Barry,

I did not doubt the mei, it was being told that it was TADASHIRO and
not finding that name anywhere. I looked in the Haynes index (which I
now proudly own) and found no such name. It is without a doubt
TADAHIRO.

I will send you pic's of another kogatana that has a mei. It looks
very suspicious to me, and I have no idea what it says. I will post
them into my album and send you same directly. Maybe it will be
legit, maybe not. Somebody at some time has tried to fake a hamon on
this little blade. I need to remove this, any ideas? I don't want to
spend any money on this blade unless the mei is real. Let me know
your thoughts. It's a learning experience!

Thanks,

Elliott

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] kogatana mei
messages.msgSnippet: G day Elliot, Firstly the name is TADAHIRO, not TADASHIRO.  I am well acquainted with this smith as I have had a katana of his for many years plus others of
messages.messageBody:
G'day Elliot,

Firstly the name is TADAHIRO, not TADASHIRO. I am well acquainted with this smith as I have had a katana of his for many years plus others of the school are well-known to me in other collections. And I have the Hizento Taikan. And I have a book on kogatana. So, please post me pics direct or I'm happy to look at them in your album. Higher res is better then lower res to send me direct, as you might resize them down for your album.

I'm presuming here that you want to know if the mei is genuine??

Regards,
Barry Thomas.

----- Original Message -----
From: Elliott
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, March 27, 2007 3:16 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] kogatana mei


It's me again...........

I am seeking any information about.... Omi Daijo Fujiwara Tadashiro .
The kogatana that I have has this mei. I cannot find the
name 'Tadashiro' anywhere. And since I cannot read kanji, I question
this name.

As soon as I can get a viewable picture of this mei (and another), I
will post to my album for all to critique. Meanwhile with your help, I
will continue searching........

Thanks as always,

Elliott
.,_._,___

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: kogatana mei
messages.msgSnippet: It s me again........... I am seeking any information about.... Omi Daijo Fujiwara Tadashiro . The kogatana that I have has this mei. I cannot find the name
messages.messageBody:
It's me again...........

I am seeking any information about.... Omi Daijo Fujiwara Tadashiro .
The kogatana that I have has this mei. I cannot find the
name 'Tadashiro' anywhere. And since I cannot read kanji, I question
this name.

As soon as I can get a viewable picture of this mei (and another), I
will post to my album for all to critique. Meanwhile with your help, I
will continue searching........

Thanks as always,

Elliott
